DataElement.preferredName: Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale 2 Last 2 Weeks Energy Level Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation in the last two weeks describing their energy level, using a 5 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale Past 2 Weeks Overall Energy Level Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A 10-item self-report questionnaire that measures quality of life for men with prostate cancer._A period of time consisting of the 14 days before the present._A question about an individual's overall energy level._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A 10-item self-report questionnaire that measures quality of life for men with prostate cancer.

Concepts.definition: A 10-item self-report questionnaire that measures quality of life for men with prostate cancer.

Property.preferredName: Past 2 Weeks Overall Energy Level Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A period of time consisting of the 14 days before the present.:A question about an individual's overall energy level.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A period of time consisting of the 14 days before the present.
A question about an individual's overall energy level.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: PORPUS:Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale, Krahn M, Ritvo P, Irvine J, et al., J Clin Epidemiol 2000

ValueDomain.preferredName: Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale Energy 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Very Full of Energy, Lots of Pep

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Very Full of Energy, Lots of Pep
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is or was very full of energy, with lots of pep.

Concepts.longName: Very Full of Energy, Lots of Pep
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is or was very full of energy, with lots of pep.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Fairly Energetic, No Limitation of Activities

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Fairly Energetic, No Limitation of Activities
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is or was fairly energetic, with no limitation of activities.

Concepts.longName: Fairly Energetic, No Limitation of Activities
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is or was fairly energetic, with no limitation of activities.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Moderate Reduction in Energy or Pep that Limits a Few Activities

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Moderate Reduction in Energy or Pep that Limits a Few Activities
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had a moderate reduction in energy or pep that limited a few activities.

Concepts.longName: Moderate Reduction in Energy or Pep that Limits a Few Activities
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had a moderate reduction in energy or pep that limited a few activities.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Generally Low Energy or Pep that Limits Some Activities

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Generally Low Energy or Pep that Limits Some Activities
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had generally low energy or pep that limited some activities.

Concepts.longName: Generally Low Energy or Pep that Limits Some Activities
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had generally low energy or pep that limited some activities.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: No Energy or Pep at All; Feel Drained, Many Activities are Limited

ValueMeaning.preferredName: No Energy or Pep at All; Feel Drained, Many Activities are Limited
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had no energy or pep at all; felt drained, with many activities limited.

Concepts.longName: No Energy or Pep at All; Feel Drained, Many Activities are Limited
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had no energy or pep at all; felt drained, with many activities limited.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Please choose the statement t
ReferenceDocuments.description: Please choose the statement that comes closest to describing your energy level in the last two weeks.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Manual Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

DataElement.origin: PORPUS:Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale, Krahn M, Ritvo P, Irvine J, et al., J Clin Epidemiol 2000
